TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a claim with ORG against ORG and ORG for recovery of a DATE allowance , compensation for non - pecuniary damage and for re - calculation of her pension .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims as unsubstantiated . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for interpretation of the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for new consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the parties appealed in cassation . The applicant had to re - lodge her appeal in cassation as she had initially failed to comply with procedural requirements .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG transferred the case for consideration to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the parties’ appeals in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for extraordinary review of the decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The case is currently pending before the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings before the first - instance court and court of appeal there were CARDINAL hearings held . The applicant supplemented her claims on QUANTITY occasions . She lodged requests for rectification of the hearing records , for studying the case - file , for obtaining additional evidence and for interpretation of the judgment .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant and her daughter instituted defamation proceedings before ORG against ORG and S. , a private person .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the claim without examination for the PERSON failure to substantiate it and to pay the court fee .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , respectively , ORG and ORG ( acting as a court of cassation ) upheld the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant and CARDINAL other persons lodged with ORG an administrative claim against ORG , alleging incorrect calculation of their pension and unlawfulness of the claim for debts issued by the local gas supplying company .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found that the claim did not fall to be examined in the framework of the administrative procedure and was to be dealt under the rules of civil procedure . Accordingly , it dismissed the claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG and ORG , respectively , upheld the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for extraordinary review of the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant and her daughter instituted defamation proceedings in ORG against ORG and S. , a private person .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the claim without examination for the PERSON failure to pay the court fee .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , respectively , ORG and ORG ( acting as a court of cassation ) upheld the decision of DATE .
